abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p>Individuals with Birt–Hogg–Dubé syndrome (BHDS) may develop fibrofolliculomas, pneumothorax and/or renal cell carcinoma (RCC). Currently, all patients with pathogenic<jats:italic>FLCN</jats:italic>variants are recommended to have renal surveillance. It has however been suggested that some<jats:italic>FLCN</jats:italic>variants only cause pneumothorax, which would make surveillance unnecessary in certain cases. This review assesses this possibility. We provide an up-to-date analysis of clinical and genetic features of BHDS. The PUBMED database was systematically searched to find all articles describing patients with pathogenic<jats:italic>FLCN</jats:italic>variants. The relevant clinical and genetic features of these patients were recorded and analysed. The prevalence of pneumothorax, pulmonary cysts, RCC and characteristic skin lesions in BHDS were 50.9% (<jats:italic>n</jats:italic> = 1038), 91.9% (<jats:italic>n</jats:italic> = 720), 22.5% (<jats:italic>n</jats:italic> = 929) and 47.9% (<jats:italic>n</jats:italic> = 989), respectively. There was a higher prevalence of pneumothoraces (<jats:italic>p</jats:italic> < 0.0001) but lower prevalence of dermatological findings (<jats:italic>p</jats:italic> < 0.0001) in patients from East Asia compared to North America or Europe. Of the 194 pathogenic<jats:italic>FLCN</jats:italic>variants, 76 could be defined as ‘pneumothorax-only’. Pneumothorax only pathogenic variants (POPVs) were distributed throughout the gene, and there were no statistical differences in variant type. The majority of POPVs (65/76) affected no more than three individuals. Individuals with ‘POPVs’ also tended to be younger (45 vs. 47 years,<jats:italic>p</jats:italic> < 0.05). Many apparent POPVs in the literature could result from variable expressivity, age-related penetrance and other confounding factors. We therefore recommend that all individuals found to carry a pathogenic<jats:italic>FLCN</jats:italic>variant be enroled in lifelong surveillance for RCC.</jats:p>

title: A systematic review assessing the existence of pneumothorax-only variants of FLCN. Implications for lifelong surveillance of renal tumours
